sub_topic: Identifying the isomorphism between two graphs.
message_2:
The given graphs G1 and G2 are not isomorphic.

To determine if two graphs are isomorphic, they must have the same number of vertices and edges, and there must be a one-to-one correspondence between their vertices such that the edges connecting the vertices are preserved.

G1 has 5 vertices and 6 edges, while G2 has 5 vertices and 7 edges. Since the number of edges is different, the graphs cannot be isomorphic.
